segments.text: I notice the overwhelming tide of water in the kitchen; it’s almost poetic in its persistence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But there’s nothing serene about the chaos it could cause.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s indifference adds a layer of tension; her focus never falters from that plate she’s drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel my heart racing for the boy on the stool—his balance looks so precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t he understand the danger of falling into that puddle?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The little girl seems blissfully unaware, just waiting for her cookie like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can’t shake the feeling that they’re both playing with fire.
segments.speaker: PAR
